posts.post_content: For now, in standard, its ok, but not great. [Faerie Trickery](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Faerie Trickery ) can definitely overshadow this card since Fae decks have lost popularity (bless you [Volcanic Fallout](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Volcanic Fallout)) and therefore less worry about not being able to counter Fae's. In extended however, I don't see [Cancel](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Cancel ) being played ever.
posts.html:

Posted By: SavageBrain89 (5/23/2009 9:58:23 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Actually I think that this is a great card, and it's very healthy for the game.
  
You see, Counterspell is just so good that it's really anoying. It was so good that it was actually pointless to play any other countermagic in place of counterspell.
  
That's when you realize that something must change. At 3 mana, cancel is very playeable but still it's no the obvious choice, the way that counterspell was. Counterspell *was* very blah, because everyone used it. With cancel, it's not always the case.
  
PD: Worse than Faerie Trickery? Like Faeries was not the strongest deck in standard.
posts.html:
Actually I think that this is a great card, and it's very healthy for the game.
You see, Counterspell is just so good that it's really anoying. It was so good that it was actually pointless to play any other countermagic in place of counterspell.
That's when you realize that something must change. At 3 mana, cancel is very playeable but still it's no the obvious choice, the way that counterspell was. Counterspell was very blah, because everyone used it. With cancel, it's not always the case.

Posted By: bark_at_the_moonn (11/13/2008 6:36:10 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: I'm all in for reprinting [Counterspell](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Counterspell), but why do people hate this thing so much? I think its considerably better than a lot of the standard/extended counters out there (at least until recently). Compared to things like [Discombobulate](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Discombobulate) and [Last Word](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Last Word), Cancel certainly isn't bad. It should be at least comparable with [Hinder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hinder), which was a good counter in its time and an uncommon.
posts.html:
I'm all in for reprinting Counterspell, but why do people hate this thing so much? I think its considerably better than a lot of the standard/extended counters out there (at least until recently). Compared to things like Discombobulate and Last Word, Cancel certainly isn't bad. It should be at least comparable with Hinder, which was a good counter in its time and an uncommon.
